name: Liam Davies P.I. and The Miserable Clown
name_original: Liam Davies P.I. and The Miserable Clown
description:
This game is a short proof of concept inspired by J.B. Harolds Murder Club made for AmalgamAsh's Smile Game Builder Jam 2021.  

After a painting was stolen from The Royal Clown Gallery it's up to you, Jake Davis, to solve the case and find out who committed the crime.

Saving doesn't work properly, but you should be able to beat this game within 10 minutes. 

Behind the scenes

This is the first time I have ever made a game and I’ve only been trying out drawing in this style for a little over a month (hence it’s not as cohesive as I’d like. Not yet!) Although this project is short and unpolished I had tons of fun making it and learned a lot of new things as well.  I've realised I never tried drawing backgrounds until last week.  

I hope to return to this project in the future to update the art, expand the story and add characters.

Walkthrough 

  1. Ask Oliver if he has more information
  2. Ask Harriet if she has more information
  3. Interrogate the suspects and make the most obvious perpetrator confess
